alert.note: Alert for Forest; Langlade; Lincoln; Marathon; Oneida; Portage; Vilas; Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 09 at 6:40AM CST until January 09 at 11:00AM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...COLD CONDITIONS EXPECTED TODAY AND FOR THE START OF THE UPCOMING WORK WEEK... .Bitterly cold arctic air spreading across the area will combine with gusty west winds to produce hazardous weather conditions for anyone outdoors without appropriate winter clothing. Wind chills around 20 below zero are expected in central and north-central Wisconsin until lunchtime today. Conditions are expected to be worse tonight into Monday morning, when the wind chill index in central and north-central Wisconsin is expected to drop to between 25 below and 35 below zero at times. Wind chills of 20 below to 30 below zero are forecast for the east. ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...The combination of wind and cold temperatures creating hazardous conditions. Wind chills around 20 below zero until lunchtime. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, and northeast Wisconsin. * WHEN...Until 11 AM CST this morning. * IMPACTS...The combination of cold temperatures and winds will result in a rapid loss of heat from exposed skin, increasing the danger of frostbite. Exposed skin can suffer frostbite in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Another Wind Chill Advisory will likely be necessary for tonight into Monday morning.
info.instruction: Wear appropriate winter clothing if going outdoors. Be sure this includes a hat and gloves or mittens.

area.areaDesc: Forest; Langlade; Lincoln; Marathon; Oneida; Portage; Vilas; Wood
